intro: Coleosanthus brachiatus var. adenopodus, commonly known as the woolly tree fern, is a distinctive tropical plant characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery, light green fronds. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. The plant features a fibrous root system that helps it anchor in moist, shaded environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens. The varietal name *adenopodus* refers to the glandular structures on its stems, which contribute to its ecological adaptations.
